title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Global Disease Detection (GDD) Program

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Center for Global Health (CGH) Division of Global Health Protection (DGHP) Global Disease Detection (GDD) Program builds global health security capacity to respond to infectious disease threats and protect lives by helping countries meet their commitments to the World Health Organization (WHO) International Health Regulations (2005). The GDD Program engages with ministries of health and other implementing partners to improve the local capacity in technical areas such as epidemiology, emergency management and response, laboratory biosafety and biosecurity, quality management systems, and level-appropriate diagnostic methodologies.

title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Immunization and Respiratory Diseases (Asian Lineage Avian Influenza [H7N9] Virus)

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) collaborates with clinical and public health laboratories located in more than 100 countries to support international surveillance for seasonal and novel influenza viruses in humans, including Asian Lineage Avian Influenza (H7N9).

title.narrative: CDC Investigations and Technical Assistance: CooperativeAgreementwiththeMinistry of Public Health (MOPH) of Thailand

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Investigations and Technical Assistance assists national and local health authorities and other health related organizations in controlling communicable diseases, chronic diseases and disorders, and other preventable health conditions. Investigations and evaluation of all methods of controlling or preventing disease and disability are carried out by providing epidemic aid, surveillance, technical assistance, consultation, and program support; and by providing leadership and coordination of joint national, state, and local efforts.

reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: Protecting and Improving Health Globally:Building and Strengthening Public Health Impact, Systems,Capacity and Security

description.narrative: Technical Collaboration to Strengthen and Expand Capacity to Assess, Prevent and Mitigate the Effects of Public Health Threats. U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) global health efforts are to assist Ministries of Health and other international partners to plan, manage effectively, and evaluate public health programs; achieve U.S. Government program and international organization goals to improve health, including disease eradication and elimination targets; expand CDC's global health programs that focus on the leading causes of worldwide mortality, morbidity and disability, including chronic disease and injuries; generate and apply new knowledge to achieve health goals; and, strengthen health systems and their impact.

reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: CDC Investigations and Technical Assistance: Ministry of Public Health (MOPH) Conducting Public Health Research in Thailand

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Investigations and Technical Assistance assists national and local health authorities and other health related organizations in controlling communicable diseases, chronic diseases and disorders, and other preventable health conditions. Investigations and evaluation of all methods of controlling or preventing disease and disability are carried out by providing epidemic aid, surveillance, technical assistance, consultation, and program support; and by providing leadership and coordination of joint national, state, and local efforts.

reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: Strengthening Public Health through Surveillance, Epidemiologic Research, Disease Detection and Prevention: Conducting Public Health Research in Thailand; Technical Collaboration with the Ministry of Public Health

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) global health efforts are to assist Ministries of Health and other international partners to plan, effectively manage and conduct public health research in the intent of public health protection; achieve US Government program and international organization goals to improve health; including surveillance, intervention and prevention in global health programs that focus on leading causes of global health security, mortality, morbidity and disability including infectious diseases including bacterial, viral and parasitic diseases , non-communicable diseases, injury and violence, environmental health, generate and apply new knowledge to achieve public health goals and strengthen public health systems and capacity.
